properties.areaDesc: Transylvania; Pickens Mountains; Macon; Southern Jackson; Oconee Mountains; Rabun
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 5:08AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
Light rain will begin to spread into the mountains this morning.
If the rain moves in early enough, temperatures would be cold
enough for light freezing rain to develop, mainly in locations
along and near the North and South Carolina border from
Transylvania and Pickens counties, west to along and near the
North Carolina and Georgia border of Macon and Rabun counties.
Although amounts will be very light, this could result in light
ice accumulations, mainly on elevated surfaces and potentially on
bridges. Temperatures will rise above freezing by noon.

Widespread hazardous travel is not expected. However, motorists
should remain alert, especially on bridges where slippery spots
often develop first.

NWSheadline: CHANCE OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN THIS MORNING
